intro: Clusia triflora var. yurumanguinis, commonly known as the Yurumanguí clusia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America, particularly Colombia and Venezuela. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are usually dark green and often have a bluish or purplish tint. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
